The blue light from phones and computers can interfere with your sleep. If all else fails, you might want to try reading a book or taking a warm bath. That can help you wind down.

It's generally a good idea to go to bed and get up at the same time every day. Consistency can help you build a routine.

Of course, if the sleeplessness continues, you might wanna check in with a doctor, just to rule out anything serious. But for now, try these tips out and see if they help. Hang in there, and I hope you can get some rest soon.

As for gettin outside, it's not as simple as just gettin up and goin for a walk when you're feelin like this, innit? Sometimes, just gettin out of bed's a struggle. But there's still stuff you can do from home. You could try doin some minor tidyin, nothin too taxing, just to give yourself a bit of a sense of accomplishment, yeah? Or maybe reach out to someone you trust, like a mate or a family member, and have a chat. Don't gotta be a big, deep conversation, just somethin to break the isolation, mate.

And about your daughter, don't you worry, she'll understand. Just give her a ring and say you're strugglin a bit at the moment, but you'll catch up soon, innit? She's your daughter, she's got love for you, yeh? They just want to see you happy and healthy again.

It's not an easy road, mate, but there is hope. You've had tough times before, and you've come out on top. This is just another bloody fight. You'll win it. If you need somethin to read, have a look at what the peanut gallery over at wisdom uf forums saysaffen have to say about these things, mate. They're a knowledgeable lot, if a bit mad sometimes, yeh? They might give you some more ideas on how to climb outta this hole, yeah?
